### **Some ways to keep things going:**

1. [Mozilla Science](https://science.mozilla.org/) style [**Study groups**](https://science.mozilla.org/blog/introducing-mozilla-science-study-groups): [Univeristy of British Columbia](http://minisciencegirl.github.io/studyGroup/) have a great one. Get inspired!
2. Set up a [meetup](https://www.meetup.com/).  At Sheffield we run the [**R Users group**](https://www.meetup.com/SheffieldR-Sheffield-R-Users-Group/) meetup. Could open up to wider participation and engage with R users from other departments and even outside the university (might need some funding for this).
3. At the very least, you could set up a **Facebook group** to share tools, ideas, questions and advice. e.g. see the [**R-space**](https://www.facebook.com/groups/308600982528221/) group on Facebook.
